name: Pepe Śrubokręcik
overview: 1995, the year Pepe Śrubokręcik was released on Amiga. Made by Wildcard and published by Alderan. Pepe Śrubokręcik is a platform arcade game where the player must collect designated number of screws on each level to gain access exit doors. The game is divided into stages, each stage consists of two levels divided into two boards full of hostile mechanised units. After collecting a single screw on the first board a new screw appears on the other one. The process repeats until the player collect the required quantity of screws. Every visit on the board enemies resurrects previously disposed enemies. Some enemies may be killed by jumping on their heads, the other may be only over jumped. The final part of the stage is played on a single screen, where Pepe the Screwdriver must defeat the final boss and his assistants. In addiction the stages are separated with mini games, such as puzzles on time.
